abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Emergency
            Horticulture and Livestock Project for Afghanistan is to
            stimulate, in focus areas, the marketable output of
            perennial horticulture and livestock enterprises by
            improving the incentive for private investment in the sector
            and by strengthening institutional capacity in agriculture.
            Negative measures include: safety of dams; forests; natural
            habitats; pest management; waste management; and cultural
            property. Mitigation measures include: a) reuse of cut
            material in hill roads; b) safe disposal of wastes; c)
            protection of boundaries from impacts due to construction;
            d) conduct of hydrological investigations during project
            preparation; e) protection of embankment slopes in case of
            alignment on embankments; f) prevent environmental
            degradation as a result of either individual subprojects or
            their cumulative effects; and g) use of pesticide and
            insecticide that may cause harm to natural resources and
            human health.
